title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: rashly neglected. He had, almost by his single andunassisted talents, stopped the irruption of thebanded force of all the Highland chiefs ; there waslittle doubt, that, with the slightest encouragement,he could put them all in motion, and renew thecivil war; and it was well known that the mostflattering overtures had been transmitted to theduke from the court of St Germains. The character and temper of Scotland was still little known,and it was considered as a volcano, which might,indeed, slumber for a series of years, but was stillliable, at a moment the least expected, to breakout into a wasteful eruption.
